venue.name: Piscassic Street Boat Launch Conservation/Recreation Area

item.description:
This event is open to all kayak types as well as canoes

Launch Site is at Sliding Rock Conservation and Recreation Area at the end of Piscassic Street Newmarket NH. This 2.5 acre parcel was donated by the Walter Cheney Companies to the Town of Newmarket. The property is situated at the confluence of the Lamprey and Piscassic Rivers aka Twin Rivers. It is an easy and leisurely paddle on slow moving water which winds through wooded areas.

Directions:
*Take Route 108 into Newmarket and turn onto Elm St, which is the street with the Newmarket Library on it.
*Take Elm about a half mile up & over a hill to Beech St.
*Turn right onto Beech & then right again at the end of Beech, on to Salmon Street. Salmon Street curves past several apt. complexes.
*Turn right onto Piscassic St at the Twin Rivers Condo complex. The launch is at the end of the street.

Life vests aka PFDs must be worn when paddling with this group

Due to cold water temps this time of year wet or dry suits are highly recommended


Google Maps directions to Piscassic St. Newmarket, NH
item.how_to_find_us: Boat Launch is at the end of Piscassic St.
item.name: Piscassic River Newmarket, NH Paddle
